elements.title: last Friday of Ramadan
elements.contents: ... that Muslims believe that giving to the poor on the last Friday of Ramadan (prayers pictured) will bring them wealth and blessings during the year and in the future?

elements.title: Thomas S. Gathright
elements.contents: ... that the only functioning secondary school in Mississippi during the American Civil War was founded by Thomas S. Gathright?

elements.title: The Extraordinary Adventures of Mr. West in the Land of the Bolsheviks
elements.contents: ... that a story titled "The Adventures of Mr. Stupidhead in Russia" may have influenced the Soviet silent comedy film The Extraordinary Adventures of Mr. West in the Land of the Bolsheviks?

elements.title: Herwig Gössl
elements.contents: ... that Herwig Gössl rejected a reform document on the Catholic theology of sexuality prepared by the Synodal Way, but later welcomed the church's decision to bless homosexual couples?

elements.title: Waste Siege: The Life of Infrastructure in Palestine
elements.contents: ... that Waste Siege: The Life of Infrastructure in Palestine is based on ten years of field research in the Israeli-occupied West Bank?

elements.title: Luming Lu
elements.contents: ... that Golden Horse Awards–winning film composer Luming Lu worked as a cram-school tutor before pursuing a career in music?

elements.title: a Ramadan television show
elements.contents: ... that a Ramadan television show featured riddles, music, choreographed dance routines and "fantastical narratives"?

elements.title: Ray Walsh
elements.contents: ... that football executive Ray Walsh also had a "murderous" forehand?

elements.title: Androsaemum androsaemum
elements.contents: ... that Androsaemum androsaemum is botanically unacceptable, but Aniculus aniculus is perfectly valid?
